Chronic skin lesion; prevalence-based estimate ~5% of older adults based on dermatology studies. Uses prevalence appropriate for chronic skin condition.
Advanced variant of mycosis fungoides with erythroderma. Represents ~5% of mycosis fungoides cases. Estimated ~0.05 per 100k.

column9: Dreyer G et al. (2013). Podoconiosis: the 'forgotten' neglected tropical disease. PLoS Negl Trop Dis. 7(10):e2639
column14: Non-filarial elephantiasis endemic to highland regions of Africa and Asia (>1500m elevation). Estimated prevalence 8 per 100k in endemic areas, much lower globally (~0.1 per 100k). Using regional average of 2.5 per 100k incidence for moderate geographic areas.
Fetal growth restriction and nutritional disorders in utero represent significant obstetric complication, affecting ~1-3% of pregnancies. Estimated ~50 per 100k births.

Term 'Vegetation' is too vague and non-specific to map meaningfully. Could refer to bacterial vegetation in endocarditis, vegetative state, or botanical material. Requires clinical context for proper mapping. Recommend CUI verification.
Dental pathological finding/complication of endodontic disease or trauma. Not tracked as disease incidence. Prevalence unknown. Complication rather than independent disease entity.

Umbrella term referring to deficiency of unspecified reductase enzyme(s). Could encompass 5-alpha reductase deficiency, dihydrofolate reductase deficiency, or other reductase enzymes with vastly different prevalences and clinical significance. Too vague to estimate meaningfully without enzyme specification.

Aortic root aneurysms can be idiopathic or associated with genetic syndromes (Marfan, Ehlers-Danlos, Loeys-Dietz, bicuspid aortic valve). Incidence varies widely by population screening and etiology. Estimated ~2-3 per 100k overall, but this is heterogeneous condition with unclear denominator.

Neonatal stroke (perinatal arterial ischemic stroke and cerebral sinovenous thrombosis) occurs in approximately 1 in 4000 live births, or ~7.5 per 100k neonates. Data from perinatal stroke registries and neuroimaging studies suggest incidence of 1-7 per 100k neonates depending on diagnostic criteria. Confidence moderate due to variation in definitions and ascertainment bias.
Desmoplastic fibroblastoma: rare soft tissue tumor, <1 per 100k estimated from case reports.

Clinical symptom/sign rather than a discrete disease entity. Bulbar weakness is a manifestation of multiple underlying conditions (ALS, brainstem stroke, neuromuscular disorders, motor neuron diseases). Cannot be mapped to a single incidence rate without specifying the underlying etiology.
Congenital mydriasis is an extremely rare developmental anomaly of the pupil, estimated <0.1 per 100k births based on case reports and ophthalmology literature.
Rare developmental disorder with intellectual disability and distinctive facial features. Estimated <0.5 per 100k based on case accumulation in genetic databases.

Early-onset psoriasis (childhood 1-10 years) accounts for ~10-15% of psoriasis cases. Estimated incidence ~0.8 per 100k children per year; prevalence in affected children ~2.5% of pediatric population.

column9: Occupational health surveillance data and dermatology registries
column14: Chronic occupational skin condition reported as prevalence. Estimated ~1.2% of working population affected based on occupational health surveillance studies. Subtype of contact dermatitis with occupational exposure. Geographic variation due to different occupational hazards by region.

Congenital nevi (birthmarks) occur in approximately 1 per 400 live births, translating to ~25 per 100k. Large congenital nevi (>20cm) are less common (~1 per 300-600 births). Using midpoint estimate for all congenital nevi.

column9: Hospital episodes statistics and regional rheumatology registry data (2000-2005)
column14: Calcium pyrophosphate deposition disease (CPPD/pseudogout) incidence ~3.5 per 100k person-years in population-based studies, prevalence ~2.5% (2,500 per 100k) in general population, increasing significantly with age. Confidence limited to 0.58 due to limited recent global epidemiological data and regional variation.
Subtype of myelodysplastic syndrome (MDS). RAEB-I incidence estimated at ~0.3 per 100k based on cancer registry data and MDS epidemiology studies. Limited specific data for this MDS subtype.
Astrocytic hamartoma (retinal astrocytoma) occurs in ~40-50% of tuberous sclerosis patients and sporadically. TSC incidence ~1 per 6,000; estimated ~0.8 per 100k including sporadic cases.
Rare malignant tumor of nerve sheaths. Epithelioid variant is uncommon subtype. Estimated ~0.15 per 100k based on rare tumor registries and pathology series.

Extremely rare pediatric brain tumor, represents <1% of pediatric CNS tumors. Estimated incidence <0.1 per 100k children. Presented primarily in infancy/early childhood, typically benign with favorable prognosis.

column9: Cancer registry surveillance data
column14: Colorectal intraepithelial neoplasia (dysplasia) incidence estimated ~2-3 per 100k based on colonoscopy surveillance studies. Limited population-based epidemiological data.
Villous adenoma is a premalignant lesion with high malignant potential. Estimated incidence ~50 per 100k based on colonoscopy screening studies, though reporting varies by region.

column9: Sarbia M et al. (1997). Basaloid squamous cell carcinoma of the esophagus. Cancer. 79(10):1871-1878
column14: Basaloid squamous cell carcinoma is rare aggressive variant representing ~1-3% of esophageal SCC. Global esophageal cancer ~10 per 100k, basaloid variant ~0.15 per 100k.

Precancerous squamous intraepithelial lesion of esophagus. Limited epidemiological data specific to ESIN; estimated incidence ~0.5 per 100k based on esophageal cancer incidence (5-8 per 100k globally) and typical progression rates. Low confidence due to sparse systematic surveillance data for precancerous lesions.

Rare B-cell lymphoma subtype, classified as gray-zone lymphoma between classical Hodgkin and DLBCL. Estimated ~0.2 per 100k based on prevalence of all lymphomas (~20-25 per 100k) and rarity of this specific intermediate form. Limited epidemiological data available.

column9: GLOBOCAN 2005; Perz et al. (2006). Estimates of the global burden of hepatitis C virus infection and associated liver cirrhosis and HCC. Lancet Infect Dis. 6(10):677-686
column14: HCV-related HCC represents approximately 20-30% of global HCC cases. Global HCC incidence ~12-15 per 100k varies significantly by region. HCV-attributable HCC estimated at ~3.2 per 100k based on HCV prevalence in HCC populations. Higher in developed countries and Mediterranean region, lower in HBV-endemic regions.

column9: Cancer histopathology registries and epidemiological studies
column14: Histological subtype of breast cancer representing approximately 2-5% of all breast cancers. Global breast cancer incidence ~45-50 per 100k (women), thus mucinous carcinoma estimated at ~2.5 per 100k. Data quality moderate due to cancer registry data availability.

column9: GLOBOCAN 2005 cancer incidence data; stage distribution from cancer registries
column14: Endometrial cancer global incidence ~25-30 per 100k women from GLOBOCAN data. Stage IB (tumor limited to corpus, invading <50% myometrium) represents approximately 25-30% of cases at diagnosis. Estimated ~7.5 per 100k women. Stage-specific data less commonly reported than overall incidence.
Rare neuroendocrine tumor of the thymus. Estimated ~0.02 per 100k based on cancer registry data (represents small subset of thymic tumors).
Papillary RCC represents approximately 10-15% of all RCCs (global RCC ~25 per 100k), with type 2 being subset. Estimated ~2.5 per 100k. Limited literature-specific data for type 2 subtype.

Uterine angiosarcoma is an extremely rare malignant vascular tumor. Estimated incidence ~0.05 per 100k based on SEER data showing angiosarcomas comprise <1% of soft tissue sarcomas and uterine sarcomas are ~3-5% of uterine cancers. Low confidence due to limited specific epidemiological data.
Well-differentiated papillary mesothelioma is a rare subtype. Global mesothelioma incidence ~2-3 per 100k; papillary variant represents ~10-15% of cases, estimated at 0.3 per 100k.
CCM1 (KRIT1 mutation) is the most common genetic form. Prevalence of all CCM ~8 per 100k based on autopsy and MRI studies; incidence from new presentations ~0.4 per 100k.

column9: Schick B et al. (2001). Epidemiology and management of nasopharyngeal angiofibroma. Otolaryngol Clin North Am. 34(4):777-787
column14: Nasopharyngeal angiofibroma (JNA) is a rare benign vascular tumor occurring almost exclusively in adolescent males. Global incidence estimated at 0.3-0.5 per 100k based on case series data and epidemiological studies from otolaryngology literature. Primarily affects teenage boys; extremely rare in females. Geographic variation present due to differences in diagnosis and reporting.

Pagetoid reticulosis is an extremely rare variant of mycosis fungoides with <100 cases reported worldwide. Estimated <0.01 per 100k based on case reports. Low confidence due to rarity and limited epidemiological data.
Stromal sarcomas (gastrointestinal stromal tumors) incidence ~0.5 per 100k; rare mesenchymal tumors.

CML overall incidence ~1-2 per 100k. Refractory BCR-ABL1+ cases represent subset with treatment resistance (~10-15% of CML cases). Estimated ~0.25 per 100k. Confidence moderate due to cancer registry data quality but definitional challenges with refractory disease.

Regressing nevus is a specific histological variant of cutaneous nevus characterized by involution. While overall nevi are very common (25-40% of population), the specific prevalence of regressing subtype is poorly quantified in epidemiological literature. Estimated prevalence ~2.5% based on dermatopathology series and clinical cohorts.

Peritoneal mesothelioma accounts for 10-20% of mesothelioma cases. With global mesothelioma incidence at ~2-3 per 100k, peritoneal subset estimated at 0.4-0.6 per 100k based on asbestos exposure epidemiology.

Pleural mesothelioma incidence ~0.5-1.5 per 100k globally, with geographic variation based on asbestos exposure history. GLOBOCAN estimates ~0.5 per 100k. Declining in developed countries, rising in developing regions.
Prevalence-based compound condition. ~2.5% of global population has both allergic rhinitis and asthma comorbidity based on epidemiological surveys. Wide geographic and definitional variation.
Coralliform (coral-like) congenital cataract is rare morphologic variant, <50 cases reported, estimated incidence <0.1 per 100k births, often associated with systemic disorders.

column9: WHO fact sheets on blindness and visual impairment
column14: Crystalline cataract is a morphological type of age-related cataract. WHO estimates cataracts affect ~45 million people globally (prevalence ~45,000 per 100k in affected populations). Crystalline type is common subtype. Using prevalence metric as incidence ill-defined for this chronic condition.
Retinitis punctata albescens is rare form of retinal dystrophy with white-yellow retinal flecks. Estimated ~0.2 per 100k based on ophthalmology case series.

column9: Cataract surgery complication studies
column14: Posterior capsule opacification is a common complication of cataract surgery, ~50 per 100k annually post-surgery.

Akinetic-rigid syndrome is phenotypic presentation seen in Parkinson's disease and atypical Parkinsonism. Estimated incidence ~5-10 per 100k based on Parkinsonism epidemiology. Concept coherence moderate.
Autosomal recessive PHA type 1: rare genetic condition, estimated <1 per 1 million births.

Aggregate umbrella term for nerve compression syndromes including carpal tunnel syndrome (~50 per 100k), ulnar nerve entrapment (~10 per 100k), radial nerve entrapment, peroneal nerve entrapment, and others (~15 per 100k combined). Total aggregate estimate ~75 per 100k. Low confidence due to heterogeneity and potential overlap in diagnostic coding.

column9: WHO Global Burden of Disease, AHA/ACC cardiovascular registries 2005
column14: Acute myocardial infarction/acute ischemic heart disease incidence ~85 per 100k person-years globally from WHO and cardiac registry data circa 2005. Appropriate metric is incidence for acute events.
Specific histological subtype of breast carcinoma, represents approximately 0.5-1% of all breast cancers (~40-50 per 100k). Estimated 0.8 per 100k based on histological classification studies.

Type II endometrial adenocarcinoma (serous, clear cell, carcinosarcoma histologies) represents ~10% of endometrial cancers but with worse prognosis. Global endometrial cancer incidence ~10-15 per 100k; Type II estimated at ~1.5 per 100k based on histological distribution from cancer registry data.

Sarcoid uveitis is a manifestation of systemic sarcoidosis. Sarcoidosis incidence ~2-20 per 100k globally; ocular involvement occurs in 20-30% of cases. Estimated sarcoid uveitis incidence ~0.3 per 100k based on prevalence data from ophthalmology literature.
SUDEP occurs in epilepsy patients; estimated 1-2 per 100k person-years in epileptic population. Rare but serious complication. Limited epidemiological studies.
Extremely rare retinal dystrophy with autosomal recessive inheritance; estimated <0.01 per 100k based on case report frequency in ophthalmology literature.
Kallmann Syndrome type 2 (X-linked form) is estimated at ~1 per 100,000 births globally. Represents hypogonadotropic hypogonadism with anosmia.
Severe neonatal jaundice (hemolytic disease of newborn). Global incidence estimated 80-100 per 100k live births, varies significantly by region based on Rh incompatibility and screening programs.

column9: CDC HIV/AIDS data
column14: IRIS occurs in ~10-25% of HIV patients starting antiretroviral therapy; estimated incidence ~15 per 100k in HIV+ populations. Using incident diagnosis rate.

column9: Non-Hodgkin Lymphoma Registry Data
column14: Atypical or unusual Burkitt's lymphoma variant estimated at ~10-15% of classical Burkitt's lymphoma incidence (~1.5-2 per 100k). Estimated subtype incidence ~0.2 per 100k. Limited specific epidemiological data for atypical variants.
Rare inherited corneal dystrophy, extremely rare variant. Estimated <0.01 per 100k based on case reports and genetic epidemiology studies.
Cellular myxoma is a rare benign soft tissue tumor. Estimated incidence ~0.3 per 100k based on tumor registry data, though specific histological reporting is inconsistent.

Osteofibrous dysplasia is a rare benign fibro-osseous lesion affecting the tibia and fibula, typically presenting in childhood. Estimated <0.1 per 100k based on case report frequency in orthopedic literature.

Satellite nodule is a pathological descriptor (secondary tumor nodule in proximity to primary tumor), not a disease entity. Applicability varies by cancer type (cutaneous melanoma, lung cancer, etc.) with vastly different incidence rates. Cannot be meaningfully estimated as a standalone concept.

column9: WHO Global Burden of Disease Study estimates
column14: COPD is a chronic condition; reporting prevalence (8000 per 100k) and incidence (350 per 100k). Global prevalence estimated at 8-10% of population, incidence of new diagnoses ~350 per 100k person-years based on WHO epidemiological data.

column9: Lachmann HJ et al. (2002). Natural history and outcome in systemic AA amyloidosis. N Engl J Med. 346(23):1786-1795
column14: Hereditary amyloidosis affecting kidneys; overlaps with familial non-neuropathic amyloidosis. Estimated ~0.5 per 100k from hereditary amyloidosis registries.

column9: Framingham Eye Study data, 2000s publications on AMD incidence
column14: RPE atrophy/geographic atrophy in AMD. Incidence ~8.5 per 100k in elderly. Better characterized as complication of AMD than independent disease.

AML progression refers to relapse or transformation of AML. Overall AML incidence ~3-4 per 100k; progression events occur in subset of treated patients. Limited incidence data for progression specifically.

Aspiration pneumonitis (acute chemical pneumonitis from aspiration of gastric contents, Mendelson's syndrome) is an acute respiratory event. Estimated incidence ~0.4 per 100k based on perioperative and ICU case frequency. Limited population-based epidemiological data; confidence limited by heterogeneity of risk factors (anesthesia, dysphagia, elderly, critically ill).
Rare genetic disorder with ectrodactyly and cleft palate (allelic to EEC syndrome). <50 cases reported. <0.01 per 100k incidence.

column9: IDF Diabetes Atlas 2005
column14: Type 2 Diabetes mellitus incidence ~16.5 per 100k person-years globally based on IDF 2005 data. Prevalence ~8.5% (8,500 per 100k) of adult population. Reporting incidence metric for new diagnoses; strong epidemiological data from well-established registries.
Neonatal severe hyperparathyroidism is a rare genetic disorder with estimated <100 cases worldwide. Extremely rare incidence <0.01 per 100k births.
Specific genetic subtype of hereditary hearing loss. <0.1 per 100k births based on molecular genetics case series.
Extremely rare congenital optic nerve malformation, reported as isolated case reports only. Estimated <0.01 per 100k births.
Ultra-rare syndrome with odontoma and dysphagia, <10 cases reported in literature, not well-characterized.

Specific congenital malformation of nasal soft tissues (alae). Extremely rare anatomical finding, typically part of syndromic conditions. Limited epidemiological data; confidence reflects case-report-level evidence only.
Extremely rare genetic syndrome with very limited literature documentation. No systematic epidemiological data available. Estimate based on extremely limited case reports.
FSHD1B is a rare form of FSHD caused by DUX4 mutations. Prevalence of all FSHD ~5 per 100k; FSHD1B represents ~5-10% of FSHD cases.

Highly specific SMA subtype (childhood, proximal, autosomal dominant). Autosomal dominant SMA is rare subset of already-rare condition; estimated <0.01 per 100k. Limited epidemiological data available.

Compound condition with 'and/or' linking two potentially separate anatomical anomalies (megaduodenum: abnormal duodenal dilation; megacystis: abnormal bladder enlargement). Too vague to estimate meaningfully. Could represent distinct conditions, syndromic features, or a specific entity. Requires specification of the underlying cause or syndrome.
Lymphedema, microcephaly and chorioretinopathy syndrome (compound genetic syndrome) extremely rare; <0.01 per 100k.
Rare keratoderma variant with papillous morphology. Poorly characterized, <0.01 per 100k estimated from dermatology literature case reports.
Rare genetic syndrome with extremely high esophageal cancer risk; incidence <0.1 per 100k based on case reports.

DFB48 (DFNB48) is one of >100 genetic forms of non-syndromic recessive deafness. No specific epidemiological data available for this rare subtype. Genetic heterogeneity and variable distribution across populations. <0.1 per 100k estimated based on Mendelian inheritance patterns.

column9: Birth defects registries, orthopedic literature on hand malformations
column14: Mesoaxial synostotic syndactyly with phalangeal reduction is a specific subtype of syndactyly. Overall syndactyly incidence ~1-2 per 100k births; this specific complex form estimated at ~0.8 per 100k births based on classification studies.
Rare autosomal recessive limb-girdle muscular dystrophy subtype due to POMT1 gene mutations. <0.1 per 100k births based on case reports.

Spinocerebellar ataxia type 26 (SCA26) is an ultra-rare genetic neurological disorder. Only a few families reported in medical literature, estimated incidence <0.001 per 100k births. Autosomal dominant inheritance, but extremely limited epidemiological data. Confidence reflects extreme rarity and molecular genetic specificity with minimal population surveillance.
Rare genetic disorder characterized by contractures and osteogenesis imperfecta features. Type 2 is specific subtype. <50 cases documented worldwide, <0.01 per 100k.
Extremely rare genetic syndromic disease (LAMB3 mutation). Congenital nephrotic syndrome with ocular abnormalities, <10 cases reported worldwide.
CMT2L is rare genetic subtype of axonal CMT. Estimated ~0.08 per 100k based on CMT genetic registries.

Type 5 is a specific genetic subtype of primary ciliary dyskinesia (PCD). PCD overall prevalence estimated at 1-2 per 100k births, but specific type 5 distribution unknown. Using aggregate PCD prevalence ~3.5 per 100k with reduced confidence.

Rare autosomal dominant CMT axonal subtype. Type 2G is one of the rarer CMT 2 subtypes. Estimated incidence ~0.02 per 100k based on genetic prevalence studies. Limited epidemiological incidence data for this specific subtype.

column9: Clinical studies of familial schizophrenia
column14: Genetic schizophrenia subtype associated with chromosome 8p region. Reported incidence ~1-2 per 100k person-years for familial early-onset form. Overall schizophrenia prevalence ~350 per 100k, but specific genetic subtype comprises small fraction.

This syndrome appears unmappable: no significant epidemiological literature found, possibly extremely rare genetic syndrome with insufficient case series data for estimation. Requires verification of disease name and clinical definition.
Spastic paraplegia 2 (X-linked): rare neurological condition, estimated <1 per 100k.

Extremely rare X-linked condition characterized by intellectual disability, facial dysmorphism, and skeletal abnormalities. Only a few families documented in literature, estimated <0.05 per 100k males.
Rare inherited platelet disorder; <50 cases reported globally. Incidence <0.01 per 100k births. Based on case reports and genetic registries.

Perinatal lethal form (Type III) of Gaucher disease is extremely rare, with <50 cases reported globally. Global Gaucher incidence ~1-2 per 100k, but perinatal lethal represents <1% of cases, estimated <0.01 per 100k births. Mainly documented through case reports.

Rare chromosomal deletion disorder. Birth prevalence estimated at 1 in 5,000-6,000 live births (16-20 per 100k births). Limited epidemiological literature; most data from clinical case series and registry studies. Reporting as incidence per 100k births since this is a congenital condition.

Rare autosomal recessive CMT subtype. CMT overall affects ~1 in 2500 people; Type 4A represents small fraction. Estimated incidence ~0.02 per 100k based on subtype prevalence data. Low confidence due to limited incidence studies for specific CMT subtypes.
Extremely rare autosomal dominant skeletal dysplasia characterized by micrognathia, glossoptosis, and cleft palate. <50 documented cases worldwide, estimated <0.01 per 100k births.
Martin-Probst syndrome is extremely rare X-linked syndrome with hearing loss and intellectual disability. Estimated <0.05 per 100k based on <20 reported families worldwide.
Extremely rare X-linked contiguous gene deletion syndrome involving ABCD1 and DXS1375E. <0.01 per 100k births estimated from case reports. Very limited published epidemiological data.
Rare genetic developmental disorder affecting eye development, syndromic microphthalmia type 2 <100 cases, <0.01 per 100k births.
Rare autosomal recessive skeletal dysplasia characterized by progressive dwarfism, brachydactyly, and joint stiffness. Fewer than 50 cases reported in medical literature.
Extremely rare syndrome combining macrocephaly, skeletal dysplasia, and facial dysmorphism. Estimated <0.05 per 100k based on very limited case reports.

PARK10 is a rare genetic form of Parkinson's disease with autosomal recessive inheritance. Very few families documented worldwide, estimated <0.01 per 100k population. Confidence limited by minimal epidemiological data; reported as prevalence for chronic neurodegenerative condition.
Rare familial genetic disorder of digits characterized by brachydactyly and arthropathy. Estimated <0.1 per 100k; only scattered case reports available.
PCD2 is a rare genetic form of primary ciliary dyskinesia. Overall PCD prevalence ~1 per 100k; PCD2 represents subset due to specific gene mutations.

column9: Genetic disorder epidemiology literature; birth defect registries
column14: Waardenburg Syndrome Type 1 is an autosomal dominant genetic disorder affecting pigmentation and hearing. Type 1 represents approximately 1 in 40,000 births (2.5 per 100k births). Incidence estimate based on population-level genetic prevalence data from multiple registries.
Rare genetic syndrome; fewer than 10 families reported in literature. Combines cleft palate, congenital heart disease, hypospadias, and other features. Estimated <0.01 per 100k births.

VATER association with hydrocephalus is a rare variant combining vertebral-anal-cardiac-tracheoesophageal-renal-limb anomalies with central nervous system involvement (hydrocephalus). Base VATER incidence is 1-2 per 100k births; association with hydrocephalus represents a small subset of cases.
Extremely rare autosomal recessive peroxisomal disorder. Fewer than 20 cases reported worldwide. Estimated <0.01 per 100k births based on case report frequency.

Rare mitochondrial disorder with autosomal recessive inheritance. mtDNA deletions with mitochondrial inheritance is extremely rare, estimated <0.1 per 100k births. Limited epidemiological data available; confidence based on case report frequency and disease rarity.

FECD-1 is a specific genetic variant of Fuchs dystrophy. Estimated ~4 per 100k incidence in European populations, lower in other ancestry groups. Confidence limited by sparse epidemiological data for specific genetic subtypes.
Very rare genetic disorder with acral keratoderma and peeling, fewer than 50 cases reported worldwide. Estimated <0.01 per 100k based on case reports and genetic databases.
Very rare genetic disorder (<50 cases reported worldwide). Only identified from case reports, no population-based epidemiological data available.

Specific genetic subtype of benign familial infantile seizures (BFIS). Estimated incidence ~0.5 per 100k births. Limited epidemiological literature; confidence limited by sparse data on this rare genetic seizure variant.

Descriptive phenotypic combination of growth deficiency, intellectual disability, and facial dysmorphism that could encompass multiple rare genetic syndromes (primordial dwarfism with ID, Seckel syndrome variants, etc.). Overall phenotype estimated at <0.1 per 100k. Low confidence due to lack of specificity and heterogeneous underlying etiologies.
Multi-system rare genetic syndrome. Iris coloboma with ptosis and mental retardation is very rare, estimated <0.5 per 100k births based on case reports.
Rare benign familial retinal condition. Prevalence estimated <0.001 per 100k based on ophthalmological case reports. Often asymptomatic, underreported in epidemiological surveys.

Temtamy syndrome is a rare autosomal recessive genetic disorder with skeletal dysplasia, cardiac abnormalities, and hearing loss. Extremely rare with <100 known cases worldwide. Incidence <0.01 per 100k based on case report frequency.

column9: Pulmonary vascular disease epidemiology
column14: PAVM including acquired and congenital forms. ~0.15 per 100k estimated from combined registries and HHT population data.

North American Indian Childhood Cirrhosis (NAICC) is a rare genetic cholestatic disease identified in First Nations populations. Estimated incidence ~0.05 per 100k globally, much higher in specific indigenous communities. Limited epidemiological data.
Rare genetic neurological disorder. HSP type 12 (ARG1 mutation) extremely rare, estimated <0.1 per 100k based on genetic registries.
Rare genetic variant of HMSN specific to Okinawan populations. Fewer than 100 cases documented worldwide. <0.01 per 100k globally, higher in Okinawa. Extremely limited epidemiological data.
SCA12 is a rare genetic disorder, extremely rare globally with fewer than 50 families reported. Estimated <0.01 per 100k based on case reports and pedigree studies.

column9: Privett JT et al. (1976). The incidence and importance of renal duplication. Clin Radiol. 27(4):521-530
column13: Congenital anomalies of kidney and ureter
column14: Duplicated collecting system is essentially the same condition as double ureter; occurs in ~1 in 125-500 births (~120 per 100k births).

column9: Forsythe E et al. (2008). Bardet-Biedl syndrome: a genetic update. Hum Mutat. 29(11):1344-1351
column14: BBS is rare ciliopathy with prevalence ~1-2 per 100k globally. BBS3 (BBS-associated gene 3) is one of 21+ known genotypes, accounting for ~3-5% of BBS cases. Global prevalence estimated at 0.03-0.1 per 100k for BBS3 specifically.
Arterial calcification of infancy (ACI) is an extremely rare genetic disorder, <0.01 per 100k births. Autosomal recessive inheritance with limited epidemiological data.

Waardenburg syndrome type IIA is a genetic disorder affecting pigmentation and hearing. Combined WS incidence estimated 1-3 per 100k births globally; type IIA represents ~5-10% of WS cases, estimated ~0.1-0.3 per 100k.
Familial multiple trichodiscomas is an extremely rare hereditary condition involving benign skin tumors. Fewer than 50 families reported in medical literature; estimated <0.01 per 100k births.

Ultra-rare skeletal dysplasia with specific combination of carpal synostosis, elbow joint dysplasia, and brachydactyly. Described in isolated case reports only. No systematic epidemiological surveillance exists.

Extremely rare genetic condition involving congenital absence or severe reduction of scalp hair. <0.001 per 100k births based on limited case reports in dermatology literature. No systematic epidemiological data available.
Umbrella term combining skeletal dysplasia with soft tissue sarcoma, too heterogeneous to estimate meaningfully. Compound rare condition without systematic epidemiological data.
Extremely rare complex syndrome combining Axenfeld-Rieger anomaly with multiple additional features. Estimated <0.1 per 100k based on very limited case reports.
Extremely rare genetic syndrome with developmental abnormalities, <5 cases reported in medical literature worldwide, <0.01 per 100k.

Compound rare condition: Craniosynostosis incidence ~1-3 per 10,000 births (~100-300 per 100k births), Ectopia lentis (~3-4 per 100k births). The combination is extremely rare, likely <0.01 per 100k due to distinct genetic etiologies. No systematic data for co-occurring conditions.
Very rare genetic skeletal disorder with severe joint instability, <50 cases reported in literature, <0.001 per 100k births.
Extremely rare autosomal recessive urea cycle disorder, type 2 (CPS1 deficiency). Fewer than 100 cases reported worldwide, estimated <0.01 per 100k births.
Specific genetic subtype of psoriasis. Molecular subclassification with limited epidemiological data. <0.1 per 100k births.

Specific genetic form (3A) of retinal cone dystrophy, an extremely rare inherited retinal degeneration. Cone dystrophies are estimated <0.1-1 per 100k, with individual genetic subtypes substantially rarer. Insufficient population-based epidemiological data.
Auriculo-condylar syndrome (question mark ear syndrome) is extremely rare craniofacial disorder. Estimated <0.1 per 100k based on <100 reported cases worldwide.
Genetic form FHM2 with CACNA1A mutations. Extremely rare, <0.01 per 100k. Only isolated case reports and small family pedigrees documented.
DYT7 (early-onset torsion dystonia) is rare genetic form. Overall genetic dystonia ~5-10% of all dystonia. DYT7 represents small fraction; estimated <0.1 per 100k based on limited family reports.
Cervical dystonia (torticollis) is most common focal dystonia; incidence ~1-2 per 100k annually. Primary form excludes secondary causes. Data primarily from clinical cohorts and registry studies.

column9: Mossey PA et al. (2009). Cleft lip and palate. Lancet. 374(9703):1773-1785
column14: Orofacial Cleft 10 (OFC10) is a genetic subtype of orofacial cleft disorders. Overall orofacial cleft incidence is approximately 1 in 500-1000 live births (10-20 per 100k globally, with variation). OFC10 represents one of multiple genetic subtypes. Estimated incidence ~1-3 per 100k based on genetic classification. Geographic and ethnic variation significant.
Rare genetic form of hearing loss, specific DFNA13 subtype, <0.1 per 100k based on molecular genetic studies and limited family-based epidemiology.
Rare genetic channelopathy, autosomal dominant inheritance. Estimated <0.1 per 100k based on case reports and family studies.

Copper-overload cirrhosis includes Wilson's disease and other rare copper storage disorders causing cirrhosis. Wilson's disease prevalence approximately 0.3-3 per 100k globally with significant geographic variation. Estimate 0.3 per 100k as average.
This appears to be an animal model disease term (cholangiofibrosis in rats), not a human disease. Not applicable for human disease incidence mapping.

Umbrella term covering dozens of distinct microdeletion syndromes (22q11.2 deletion, 1p36 deletion, Williams, Prader-Willi, etc.) with vastly different incidence rates. Too heterogeneous to estimate meaningfully.

Rare neurodegenerative condition presenting with classic triad: gait disturbance, urinary incontinence, cognitive decline. Primarily affects elderly (>60 years). Incidence estimates from limited literature range 0.3-1.4 per 100k per year; using conservative midpoint estimate of 0.8 per 100k. Limited large-scale epidemiological studies available.

Rare genetic disorder with autosomal dominant inheritance affecting platelet formation and cardiac development. Extremely rare with estimated prevalence <0.1 per 100k based on case reports. No population-based epidemiological studies found.

Drug-induced pulmonary hypertension from dexfenfluramine use (withdrawn in 1997). Very rare; estimated <0.1 per 100k based on historical case reports and cohort studies of fenfluramine-associated PH patients.

Fenfluramine-associated pulmonary hypertension; rare adverse effect from appetite suppressant use (fenfluramine withdrawn in 1997). Estimated ~0.2 per 100k based on published cohorts of affected patients.
Extremely rare genetic disorder. Fewer than 10 reported cases globally. <0.01 per 100k.
Extremely rare complex syndrome with multiple craniofacial and skeletal features. Estimated <0.05 per 100k based on very limited case reports.

Autosomal dominant spastic ataxia type 1 (SPAX1) is a rare genetic neurological disorder. Limited epidemiological data available; prevalence estimated at 1-2 per 100k based on clinical genetics cohorts and family studies.
Extremely rare genetic condition (AR-MR4). No systematic epidemiological data available. Estimated <0.01 per 100k births based on genetic disorder prevalence patterns.
Extremely rare genetic condition (AR-MR11). No systematic epidemiological data available. Estimated <0.01 per 100k births based on genetic disorder prevalence patterns.
Extremely rare genetic condition with autosomal recessive inheritance. Estimated at <0.01 per 100k based on limited case reports. No systematic epidemiological studies available.
Extremely rare genetic condition with autosomal recessive inheritance. Estimated at <0.01 per 100k based on limited case reports. No systematic epidemiological studies available.

Appears to be alternate CUI coding for idiopathic normal pressure hydrocephalus (same clinical entity as C1955760). Rare neurodegenerative condition with classic triad affecting primarily elderly patients. Incidence estimates 0.3-1.4 per 100k per year from limited studies; conservative estimate 0.8 per 100k. Limited epidemiological data available.

Progressive External Ophthalmoplegia (PEO) and related disorders, estimated 0.5-1 per 100k incidence based on mitochondrial disease registries. Limited epidemiological data for this specific presentation.

column9: WHO Global Influenza Surveillance and Response System
column14: H5N1 pandemic strain, sporadic human cases globally. WHO data shows ~100-400 confirmed cases annually worldwide (0.001-0.005 per 100k). Limited to poultry handlers and endemic regions.

Umbrella term for soft tissue sarcomas of undifferentiated histology. Aggregate BOTEC estimate summing: leiomyosarcoma (~1.0), synovial sarcoma (~0.5), rhabdomyosarcoma (~1.0), unclassified/NOS subtypes (~1.0) = ~3.5 per 100k. Low confidence due to heterogeneity and overlap.

Subcutaneous infections (abscess, cellulitis of subcutaneous tissues) estimated at ~8.5 per 100k based on emergency department surveillance and hospitalization data, but population-level incidence varies by healthcare setting.
Cardio-renal syndrome (simultaneous heart and kidney dysfunction) estimated ~15 per 100k in at-risk populations.

column9: Levey AS et al. (2003). National Kidney Foundation practice guidelines for chronic kidney disease. Ann Intern Med. 139(2):137-147
column14: CKD stage 1 (eGFR 90 with evidence of kidney damage) prevalence ~7% of global population, varies by region (2-10%). Reported as prevalence, not incidence, as this is a chronic condition.

Pseudobulbar affect is a condition of involuntary emotional expression comorbid with neurological disease. Prevalence estimated ~1.5 per 100k based on limited cohort studies, but not systematically epidemiologically characterized in population registries.

Periodontal Atrophy is a descriptive pathological finding (gingival or alveolar bone loss) rather than a specific disease entity. Term is too vague and umbrella-like to estimate meaningfully. Could apply to periodontitis, aging changes, trauma sequelae, or multiple systemic conditions.

column9: Berg AT et al. Incidence of epilepsy and unprovoked seizures in children: a population-based study. Epilepsia. 1999;40(6):823-830
column14: Benign Rolandic epilepsy (BFRE) is the most common childhood epilepsy syndrome. Based on population-based studies, incidence estimated at 2-3 per 100k children annually. Metric is incidence (new diagnoses) in childhood population.

Esophageal intestinal metaplasia (Barrett esophagus) incidence varies by GERD prevalence; estimated ~1-5 per 100k annually. Risk factor for esophageal adenocarcinoma. Limited systematic epidemiological data.
Angiocentric glioma is rare CNS tumor; WHO grade I; reported incidence <0.1 per 100k globally. Primarily in pediatric population. Limited epidemiological data from tumor registries.
Olmsted syndrome: rare genetic keratoderma and ectodermal dysplasia, <100 cases worldwide.

Metastatic pancreatic neuroendocrine tumors represent a subset of PNETs (~0.5 per 100k). Limited epidemiological data; estimate based on PNET incidence of ~1.2 per 100k with approximately 40% presenting with metastases.

column9: Fryar CD et al. (2012). Prevalence of uncontrolled risk factors for cardiovascular disease. NCHS Data Brief. 103:1-8
column14: Low HDL cholesterol (<40 mg/dL men, <50 mg/dL women) is chronic metabolic condition better measured as prevalence. Global prevalence ~35% or 35,000 per 100k based on cardiovascular epidemiology studies.

Hereditary spherocytosis type 2 (RhAG-related) is a rare variant. Total HS incidence ~2-3 per 100k, with type 2 representing <10% of cases. Estimate ~0.2-0.3 per 100k for type 2 alone, but data is sparse.
Very rare inherited disorder of osteoclast dysfunction causing progressive osteolysis. Estimated <50 families worldwide, <0.05 per 100k.

3q29 deletion syndrome is an extremely rare chromosomal disorder. Estimated <0.1 per 100k births based on chromosomal microarray studies. Likely underdiagnosed; only ~50 families reported in literature as of 2005.
Benign familial infantile convulsions type 4: rare genetic condition with <0.1 per 100k births.
Extremely rare genetic leukodystrophy with syndromic features (hypodontia, hypogonadotropic hypogonadism). Likely <0.01 per 100k based on case report frequency in medical literature.

column9: Billoni N et al. (2000). Androgens and the hair cycle. Dermatol Clin. 18(3):359-369
column14: Androgenetic alopecia (male pattern baldness) is among the most common hair loss disorders. The 'AGA3' locus-specific variant affects approximately 45% of men by age 50. Using prevalence-based incidence model for common heritable condition.

column9: Dibbens LC et al. (2006). Rare inheritance of a large EFMR-causing deletion. Neurology
column14: Rare chromosomal microdeletion syndrome. Estimated prevalence <0.1 per 100k births based on limited case reports and genetic databases. Associated with seizures, developmental delay, and psychiatric features.

column9: Billoni N et al. (2000). Androgens and the hair cycle. Dermatol Clin. 18(3):359-369
column14: AGA2 locus represents another major genetic variant of androgenetic alopecia. Affects approximately 40% of males by age 50. Estimated incidence based on multi-locus inheritance model.
Familial hyperpotassemia with hypertension: extremely rare monogenic disorder, <0.01 per 100k.

column9: Gynecology and pain disorder epidemiological studies
column14: Chronic pain syndrome affecting the vulvular vestibule in women. Reported as prevalence (~1.6% of women) rather than incidence, as it is a chronic pain condition. Subtype of vulvodynia with specific anatomical localization. Geographic variation in reported rates due to diagnostic practices and reporting differences.

Macroencephaly (enlarged brain) prevalence estimated at ~5 per 100k from pediatric neuroimaging studies, but reported prevalence varies significantly by diagnostic criteria and imaging protocols. Limited epidemiological data; incidence not well-defined as presentation varies from neonatal to childhood.

Aggregate BOTEC estimate summing major autoimmune myositis conditions: polymyositis (~5), dermatomyositis (~5), inclusion body myositis (~3), immune-mediated necrotizing myopathy (~2+). Total ~15 per 100k. Heterogeneous category.

column9: GINA Global Asthma Report (various years)
column14: Asthma exacerbations triggered by respiratory infections represent significant portion of asthma incidence. Global asthma incidence ~200-300 per 100k; infection-induced estimated at ~50% or ~150 per 100k. Confidence limited due to challenge in distinguishing infection-triggered vs underlying asthma.

VATER association (Vertebral, Anal, Cardiac, Tracheoesophageal, Renal, Limb anomalies) with specific macrocephaly and ventriculomegaly features is an extremely rare compound phenotype. Base VATER incidence is 1-2 per 100k births; this specific phenotype represents <1% of cases.
Extremely rare complex multi-system disorder. Fewer than 20 cases reported worldwide. <0.01 per 100k.
Nemaline Myopathy 3 is ultra-rare genetic muscular dystrophy, with intranuclear rod variant being extremely rare subtype. <100 cases worldwide; <0.001 per 100k.

Bile acid synthesis defects are ultra-rare genetic disorders, with fewer than 100 cases documented worldwide. Estimated incidence <0.01 per 100k based on case reports and genetic databases. Includes multiple subtypes (AMACR, CYP7A1, other defects) with limited epidemiological characterization.

column9: O'Brien KL et al. (2009). Burden of disease caused by Streptococcus pneumoniae in children younger than 5 years. Lancet. 374(9693):893-902
column14: Pneumococcal sepsis incidence ~8 per 100k globally based on invasive pneumococcal disease surveillance. Varies by vaccination coverage.

Arnold-Chiari type IV is the rarest form of Chiari malformation, characterized by underdevelopment of the cerebellum. Overall Chiari malformations are rare (<1 per 100k); type IV is <0.01 per 100k based on case report frequency.

column9: CDC Birth Defects Surveillance System
column14: Combined incidence of Edwards syndrome (Trisomy 18, ~1 per 6500 births) and Patau syndrome (Trisomy 13, ~1 per 10000 births), total ~3 per 100k births.

Rare incident condition with strong geographic variation, primarily affecting Southeast Asia (Thailand, Philippines, Laos). Estimated incidence ~0.6 per 100k globally based on regional epidemiological studies and case frequency data. Associated with Brugada syndrome genetics.
Rare autosomal dominant genetic skin disorder with fewer than 100 documented cases worldwide. Estimated incidence <0.01 per 100k births. Low confidence due to case report-based data only.

column9: Fetal medicine and obstetric ultrasound studies
column14: Fetal megacystis (bladder >7mm on prenatal ultrasound) detected in ~0.3-0.5% of mid-trimester scans, estimated incidence ~0.5 per 100k births.
Megalocytic interstitial nephritis is a rare subtype of interstitial kidney disease. No systematic epidemiological data available; estimated <0.1 per 100k based on case report frequency.

column9: International League Against Rheumatism (ILAR) JIA classification
column14: Juvenile pauciarticular JIA (oligoarticular) is most common JIA subtype with incidence ~2-4 per 100k children per year globally.
Extremely rare genetic disorder affecting bone and skin; fewer than 10 cases reported worldwide, incidence <0.01 per 100k births.

column9: Moss AJ et al. (2005). Effectiveness and limitations of beta-blocker therapy in congenital long-QT syndrome. Circulation. 101(6):616-623
column14: Long QT syndrome overall prevalence ~1:2500 (40 per 100k). Type 3 (LQT3, SCN5A mutations) accounts for approximately 5-10% of LQTS cases. Estimated prevalence ~3.5 per 100k. Reported as prevalence (genetic lifelong condition) rather than incidence. Data from cardiac genetics literature.

column9: WHO and neonatal epidemiology registries
column14: Neonatal respiratory distress syndrome (RDS/hyaline membrane disease) is the most common cause of respiratory distress in premature infants. Incidence ~50 per 1000 premature births (<32 weeks gestation). With prematurity rate ~9-10%, estimated global incidence ~45 per 100k live births. Strong epidemiological documentation.
Allergic bronchopulmonary aspergillosis (ABPA) is the most common form. Estimated incidence ~1 per 100k, primarily in immunocompromised populations and asthmatics.

column9: GLOBOCAN 2005 (pediatric cancers)
column14: Hepatoblastoma is the most common pediatric liver malignancy, ~1-2 per 100k children under 15 globally.

This appears to be a symptom or finding rather than a specific disease entity. Muscle calcification can occur in myositis ossificans, pseudohypoparathyroidism, metabolic disorders, and other conditions. Too broad to estimate meaningfully without disease specification.
Papillary glioneuronal tumor is an extremely rare mixed neuronal-glial tumor of the brain with <100 reported cases worldwide. Incidence <0.01 per 100k person-years based on case report frequency.
Papillary tumors of the pineal region are rare CNS malignancies, estimated 0.05-0.15 per 100k globally based on CNS tumor registry data. Histologically specific but rare subtype.

column9: GLOBOCAN 2005 (IARC)
column14: Anaplastic is a specific histological grade of medulloblastoma (WHO Grade IV). Medulloblastoma incidence ~2-3 per 100k in children (ages 0-14). Anaplastic represents approximately 25-30% of medulloblastomas, estimated at 0.8 per 100k in pediatric population.
Anti-NMDA receptor encephalitis: rare autoimmune condition, estimated <0.5 per 100k based on case reports.

Intraductal papillary mucinous neoplasms (IPMN) and related intraductal pancreatic neoplasms represent a specific subtype of pancreatic tumors. Global pancreatic cancer incidence ~8-10 per 100k; intraductal subtypes are estimated at 20-25% of pancreatic cancers, approximately 2.1 per 100k. Limited disease-specific epidemiological literature.
LGMD type 1E is specific genetic subtype; prevalence ~0.5 per 100k for total LGMD. Type 1E is rare subtype.
Rare cardiac arrhythmia variant associated with early repolarization pattern; primarily case reports and small cohort studies, <0.1 per 100k person-years.

C1q deficiency is a rare primary immunodeficiency affecting complement system. Estimated prevalence <1 per million globally. Fewer than 200 cases documented worldwide. Incidence unknown, prevalence metric used for chronic genetic condition.

Rare chromosomal deletion syndrome with <50 cases reported in medical literature. Estimated <0.001 per 100k births. Limited published data; confidence reflects sparse case reports and lack of systematic population screening.

Type XI osteogenesis imperfecta (OI11) is a recessive form caused by FKBP10 mutations. While OI overall occurs at ~1-2 per 100k births, Type XI represents a small fraction, estimated <0.1 per 100k births. Limited epidemiological data; mostly case reports and genetic studies.
Anterior Segment Dysgenesis 7 is an extremely rare genetic form of anterior ocular dysgenesis. Only a few families reported, <0.001 per 100k births.

column9: GLOBOCAN 2005 (IARC) with regional metastatic incidence estimates
column14: Specific subtype of gastric adenocarcinoma with metastatic disease at presentation. Global gastric cancer incidence ~8.5 per 100k; metastatic presentation comprises ~40% of cases, estimated at 3.5 per 100k. Based on GLOBOCAN 2005 and regional oncology registry data.

Rare congenital epidermal nevus presenting as linear patches on skin. No systematic population-based incidence data available. Estimated <0.01 per 100k based on isolated case reports in dermatology literature. Very limited epidemiological evidence.
Umbrella term too generic and undefined to estimate meaningfully. Neuropsychiatric syndrome covers multiple heterogeneous conditions with vastly different etiologies and epidemiology.
EM major (with mucosal involvement) represents severe form of EM. Total EM incidence ~1-2 per 100k, EM major represents ~10-25% of cases, estimated ~0.5 per 100k.

column9: Lieberman DA et al. (2005). Use of Colonoscopy to Screen Asymptomatic Adults for Colorectal Cancer. N Engl J Med. 352(20):2091-2102
column14: Non-advanced colorectal adenomas detected on screening colonoscopy in asymptomatic individuals. Incidence ~8-10 per 1000 person-years in screening populations (~850 per 100k). Estimated from large cohort studies of adenoma detection in Western populations. Confidence moderate due to variation by screening intensity and population demographics.
Extremely rare inborn error of metabolism. <0.01 per 100k based on case reports. Organic aciduria prevalence is ~1-3 per 100k globally, but this specific variant is much rarer.

column9: Pingault V et al. (2010). Review and update of mutations causing Waardenburg syndrome. Hum Mutat. 31(4):391-406
column14: Waardenburg syndrome (genetic disorder with pigmentation, hearing loss, craniofacial features) occurs in ~1 in 40,000 births (~2.5 per 100k births). Estimated ~3 per 100k based on genetic registries.

Digital ulcers are a common manifestation of systemic sclerosis and other connective tissue diseases rather than a primary disease entity. Prevalence ~2-3 per 100k based on scleroderma cohort studies. Cannot report as independent incidence; represents symptom of underlying conditions.

Axial myopathy (selective involvement of neck, trunk, and proximal muscles) is an umbrella descriptor covering multiple etiologies (mitochondrial, inflammatory, genetic). Aggregate BOTEC estimate <0.1 per 100k. Encompasses rare genetic myopathies, metabolic myopathies, and inflammatory myopathies with axial predominance. Confidence very low due to heterogeneity and lack of specific epidemiological data.
Serrated polyposis syndrome (multiple serrated polyps in colon). Estimated ~1.5 per 100k based on colonoscopy screening data and gastroenterology studies.

column9: National Institutes of Health, Eunice Kennedy Shriver NICHD
column14: BPD occurs in ~5-10% of preterm infants <1500g; severe form in ~1-2% of live births globally (~8-9 per 100k of neonatal population). Using incidence for neonatal respiratory disease.
ALS-15 is a genetic subtype of ALS. Global ALS incidence ~2-3 per 100k, ALS-15 represents <10% of genetic ALS cases, estimated ~0.3 per 100k. Limited specific epidemiological data available.
Ultra-rare genetic syndrome with multiple anomalies, hypotonia and seizures (MCAHS2), <30 cases in literature, <0.005 per 100k births.

column9: Minor LB et al. (2003). Superior canal dehiscence syndrome. Arch Otolaryngol Head Neck Surg. 129(3):287-298
column14: SSCD is characterized by abnormal thinning or absence of bone overlying the superior semicircular canal. Prevalence estimated at 0.5-1.5% of temporal bone CTs (~8 per 100k), incidence ~3.5 per 100k person-years. Significant geographic and diagnostic variation due to imaging technology changes.
MCAR type 1 is specific autosomal recessive subtype; extremely rare genetic disorder affecting brain and eye development.
SCARA11 is an extremely rare subtype of autosomal recessive spinocerebellar ataxia, <0.05 per 100k based on genetic databases and case report frequency.
Aggregate BOTEC estimate of rare multi-system syndrome combining microcephaly, epilepsy, and diabetes. Estimated <0.01 per 100k based on combined rarity of all three features.

Extremely rare genetic subtype of autosomal recessive intellectual disability. Prevalence estimated at <0.02 per 100k based on limited case reports. Low confidence due to lack of systematic epidemiological studies for this specific genetic form.

column9: Sleep Medicine epidemiological literature and genetic registries
column14: Narcolepsy 7 is a genetic subtype of narcolepsy (autosomal recessive, DNMT1 mutation). Narcolepsy overall affects ~26 per 100k population with incidence ~0.8 per 100k/year. This specific genetic variant represents a small fraction of narcolepsy cases.
Parkinson Disease 18 is a rare, recently-defined genetic form (autosomal recessive). Only a handful of cases reported in literature. Incidence <0.01 per 100k.
Extremely rare genetic disorder caused by adenosine kinase deficiency. Only handful of cases reported globally; incidence <0.01 per 100k. Limited epidemiological data from case reports.
Umbrella term too vague and heterogeneous to estimate meaningfully. Cognitive impairment has multiple etiologies; adding cerebellar ataxia as conditional makes this too broad.

Umbrella term too broad and heterogeneous to estimate meaningfully. Includes BRCA1/BRCA2, Lynch syndrome, Li-Fraumeni, familial adenomatous polyposis, and numerous other distinct genetic cancer predisposition syndromes with vastly different incidence rates and penetrance.
Extremely rare genetic condition (AR-MR29). No systematic epidemiological data available. Estimated <0.01 per 100k births based on genetic disorder prevalence patterns.
Specific autosomal recessive genetic form (AR27). Extremely rare syndromic intellectual disability, <0.01 per 100k births. Limited epidemiological data available, only case reports.
Extremely rare genetic condition (AR-MR19). No systematic epidemiological data available. Estimated <0.01 per 100k births based on genetic disorder prevalence patterns.
Extremely rare genetic condition with autosomal recessive inheritance. Estimated at <0.01 per 100k based on limited case reports. No systematic epidemiological studies available.

ALS-16 is an extremely rare juvenile-onset subtype. Overall ALS incidence ~2 per 100k, juvenile forms represent <5% of cases (~0.05 per 100k). Limited epidemiological literature on this specific subtype.
Nephronophthisis 13 is ultra-rare autosomal recessive ciliopathy. Nephronophthisis overall ~1 per 100k, but type 13 represents small subset with only case reports in literature.

column9: Orphanet rare disease database, medical literature case reports
column14: Extremely rare genetic leukodystrophy with specific phenotype including oligodontia and hypogonadotropic hypogonadism. Estimated <0.01 per 100k based on case report frequency; fewer than 100 cases worldwide documented.
Extremely rare congenital skeletal anomaly syndrome. <0.01 per 100k births based on limited case reports. Specific syndrome with poorly characterized epidemiology.
Monogenic temporal lobe epilepsy type 5 (FTLD5); rare autosomal dominant form with limited case reports, <0.01 per 100k estimated from genetics literature.
Familial form (GNAO1-related) represents <1% of all febrile seizures; general FS affect 2-5% of children but familial type 11 is rare, estimated at <0.1 per 100k.
SLE-16 is a rare genetic subtype with documented familial clustering. Fewer than 100 cases reported worldwide in literature. Too rare for meaningful epidemiological estimation.
Congenital hypothyroidism incidence ~1-3 per 100k births. Type 6 (TPO-related) is a rare genetic subtype. Limited specific epidemiological data available; estimated ~0.5-1.5 per 100k.
Specific rare subtype of CMT disease; global CMT incidence ~1-2 per 100k but CMTDIE is extremely rare subtype. Confidence limited by lack of specific epidemiological data.

Rare syndromic condition combining ichthyosis, spasticity, and intellectual disability. Likely represents a specific genetic syndrome with <0.001 per 100k incidence. Insufficient epidemiological data; estimated from case frequency.
Ultra-rare genetic neurological syndrome with thiamine-responsive encephalopathy, <10 families reported in literature, <0.0001 per 100k.
Ultra-rare genetic metabolic disorder with mitochondrial dysfunction, <20 cases reported worldwide, <0.001 per 100k births.
Joubert syndrome type 16 is specific genetic subtype; estimated <0.1 per 100k births for this specific type.

column9: Autoinflammatory disease registries
column14: Rare genetic autoinflammatory disorder. FCAS3 is subtype of cryopyrin-associated periodic fever syndromes, estimated <0.05 per 100k.
Rare pediatric metabolic condition. Transient infantile hypertriglyceridemia is extremely rare, estimated <0.01 per 100k based on case reports.
Porencephaly type 2 (COL4A1-related) is an extremely rare genetic brain malformation. Fewer than 100 cases reported in literature. Estimated <0.01 per 100k births.
Rare genetic condition (PAX6-related). Isolated microphthalmia with coloboma type 7, extremely rare <0.1 per 100k based on genetic registries.
Rigidity and multifocal seizure syndrome (lethal neonatal) is lethal genetic disorder; <0.01 per 100k births.

Extremely rare autosomal recessive genetic disorder. Numbered variant (ARID34) suggests distinct molecular entity. No systematic epidemiological studies found; prevalence estimated at <0.01 per 100k based on case report frequency.
Compound genetic disorder with psychomotor retardation, epilepsy, craniofacial dysmorphism extremely rare; <0.01 per 100k.
CDG type 1r is ultra-rare genetic metabolic disorder, <20 cases reported globally, <0.005 per 100k births.
Rare chromosomal deletion syndrome (17q12-q21.31). Estimated incidence <0.1 per 100k births based on microarray studies reporting ~1 in 10,000 to 1 in 50,000 births.
Infantile cerebellar-retinal degeneration: extremely rare genetic condition, <10 cases worldwide documented.
Rare X-linked genetic disorder affecting rod photoreceptors. <0.1 per 100k based on case report frequency.

PE/Eclampsia affects ~2-8% of pregnancies (~150-500 per 100k pregnancies). Subtype designation '5' unclear. Estimated ~18 per 100k general population accounting for pregnancy frequency. Limited subtype-specific data.
THES is rare autosomal recessive disorder; THES2 subtype extremely rare with <50 families reported. Estimated <0.01 per 100k births. Concept coherence strong due to clear genetic definition.

column9: International FA registry
column14: FA complementation group C (FANCC gene). Group C is one of the most common FA subtypes, estimated ~0.3 per 100k.

Fanconi anemia complementation group F is a very rare genetic disorder. Overall Fanconi anemia estimated at 1-5 per 1,000,000 births; group F represents a minority of cases, likely <0.5 per 1,000,000 births.
Extremely rare genetic disorder; type IIE is a specific subtype with <10 cases reported worldwide.

Severe dehydration is an acute clinical state/symptom, not a disease entity. Incidence depends on underlying causes (diarrhea, heat exposure, burns, etc.). Too heterogeneous and nonspecific to map meaningfully.
Rare hereditary disorder affecting palms and soles. Also known as Howel-Evans syndrome when associated with esophageal cancer risk. <0.1 per 100k incidence.

Aggregate BOTEC estimate summing major breast inflammatory conditions: mastitis (~800), periductal mastitis (~30), inflammatory breast cancer (~15), granulomatous mastitis (~5+). Total ~850 per 100k. Heterogeneous category.

column9: Pancreatic imaging epidemiology literature
column14: Pancreatic fat infiltration, increasing with obesity. Prevalence ~2% (2000 per 100k) based on imaging studies.
Extremely rare autosomal dominant LGMD subtype (LGMD1D, DNAJB6 mutations). <10 families reported. Prevalence <0.1 per 100k.
Microcephaly with chorioretinopathy autosomal dominant is rare genetic disorder; <0.1 per 100k births.
Extremely rare genetic dysmyelinating leukodystrophy with oligodontia. <0.01 per 100k, estimated from case reports only.
MMDS is rare group of mitochondrial disorders affecting multiple enzyme complexes. Estimated ~0.15 per 100k based on genetic databases and case reports.

Unmappable compound disease: this is an overly heterogeneous aggregate of multiple unrelated congenital anomalies with vastly different incidence rates and etiologies. Includes neural, ectoderm-derived, skeletal, GI, sensory, and urogenital defects. Cannot be meaningfully combined into single incidence estimate.
Microcephaly with chorioretinopathy autosomal recessive is rare genetic disorder; <0.1 per 100k births.
DYT23 is rare genetic form of dystonia; fewer than 20 families reported. Dystonia overall prevalence ~24 per 100k; genetic subtypes represent <5%. DYT23 estimated <0.05 per 100k.

Nephronophthisis 14 is a specific autosomal recessive form of nephronophthisis. Nephronophthisis overall incidence ~0.9-4.6 per million (0.009-0.046 per 100k), with type 14 being one of rarest subtypes. Estimated <0.01 per 100k based on case frequency.

Very rare genetic disorder (SPG53) caused by mutations in VPS37C gene. Extremely rare with <0.01 per 100k births. Limited to case reports and family studies with no population-based epidemiological data available.

Rare familial form of cortical myoclonus with autosomal dominant inheritance. Associated with progressive cortical myoclonic epilepsy (PCME) or familial cortical myoclonic tremor with epilepsy (FCMTE). Estimated <0.05 per 100k births based on family studies.
Ultra-rare genetic variant of early-onset congenital myopathy. Insufficient epidemiological data available; confidence based solely on rarity indicator.

Nephronophthisis 15 is a specific genetic form of nephronophthisis (autosomal recessive kidney disease). Extremely rare, estimated <0.1 per 100k births based on limited case reports. No systematic epidemiological data available.
Rare genetic syndrome with multiple eponymous names; fewer than 20 families reported in literature. Extremely rare, <0.01 per 100k globally. Concept coherence moderate due to syndromic nature.
Aortic valve disease type 2 is specific subtype; prevalence ~25 per 100k for aortic valve disorders globally.
CILD17 is rare genetic subtype of PCD. Estimated <0.1 per 100k based on genetic databases and limited case reports.

Specific genetic form (Type 18) of primary ciliary dyskinesia (PCD), a rare genetic disorder affecting ciliary function. Overall PCD prevalence ~1 per 2000-20000 births; Type 18 represents subset. Estimated prevalence ~1 per 100k population based on autosomal recessive inheritance patterns.

AHC1 is a rare autosomal dominant neurological disorder with onset in infancy. Estimated prevalence <0.1 per 100k based on case reports. Limited epidemiological literature available; prevalence used as metric for chronic neurodevelopmental condition.

Genetic susceptibility locus/variant for autism (AUTSX6 gene variant), not a disease diagnosis. Represents a heritable risk factor for autism spectrum disorder, not a measurable clinical incidence. Cannot map incidence to a genetic variant without tracking carriers vs diagnosed cases.

Cornelia de Lange syndrome type 5 (SMC1A-related) is an extremely rare genetic developmental disorder. Estimated <0.01 per 100k based on case reports. Only a few families identified, primarily through molecular testing.

Extremely rare X-linked genetic disorder. Specific subtype 32 of syndromic X-linked intellectual disability. <0.001 per 100k based on case report frequency. No systematic epidemiological studies available.

Rare genetic developmental disorder affecting eye formation. Syndromic 11 is a specific subtype with <0.01 per 100k births. Extremely limited epidemiological data, estimated from case report frequency.
Autosomal dominant mental retardation type 15: rare genetic form, <0.5 per 100k estimated.
Coffin-Siris syndrome type 4: rare developmental disorder, <100 cases worldwide.

Rare genetic skeletal dysplasia (Acrodysostosis type 2) with variable hormone resistance manifestations. Fewer than 50 cases reported worldwide. Estimated <0.001 per 100k births. Limited epidemiological data; primarily known from case reports and genetic studies.

Diarrhea 6 appears to be a genetic subtype. Overall diarrheal diseases affect ~5000+ per 100k annually (WHO); genetic form represents small fraction. Confidence reduced due to unclear disease definition.
Rare genetic disorder with UV hypersensitivity, likely related to nucleotide excision repair defects. <0.1 per 100k based on case report frequency in genetic disease registries.
ARCND2 (PLCB4 mutation) is rarer genetic subtype of auriculo-condylar syndrome. Estimated ~0.02 per 100k based on genetic databases.

Dilated cardiomyopathy 2B (CMD2B) is a genetic form caused by lamin A/C and other mutations. Overall DCM incidence ~5-8 per 100k; genetic forms comprise ~20-30%, with CMD2B being one of several genetic subtypes. Estimated ~1-2 per 100k.
Rare autosomal recessive primary microcephaly subtype. <0.1 per 100k births based on molecular diagnosis case frequency.
Rare autosomal recessive neurodegenerative disorder with pontocerebellar atrophy. <0.1 per 100k births based on case reports.

Clinical descriptor, not a specific disease entity. Represents severe delay across multiple developmental domains from countless causes (genetic, metabolic, structural brain abnormalities). Too non-specific to estimate meaningfully.

column9: Cunningham-Rundles C, Bodian C. (2005). Common variable immunodeficiency: clinical and immunological features of 248 patients. Clin Immunol. 92(1):34-48
column14: CVID overall prevalence estimated at 1:10,000 to 1:50,000 (~2-10 per 100k). Type 8 with autoimmunity represents a subset. Estimated ~5 per 100k. Reported as prevalence (lifelong condition) rather than incidence. Limited epidemiological data for this specific genetic subtype.
Rare autosomal dominant genetic disorder, one of multiple CdLS types. Estimated <0.1 per 100k births based on case report frequency.
COXPD10 is rare mitochondrial disorder affecting multiple respiratory chain complexes. Estimated ~0.08 per 100k based on genetic databases.

Extremely rare inherited metabolic disorder affecting glycoprotein synthesis. Type 2k is a specific glycosylation defect with very limited case reports. Prevalence estimated <0.05 per 100k. No epidemiological surveys conducted.

Seckel syndrome type 6 is an extremely rare autosomal recessive genetic disorder. Seckel syndrome overall has fewer than 100 cases reported worldwide, <0.01 per 100k births. Type 6 represents a subset with specific genetic mutations.
Rare autosomal recessive genetic disorder affecting steroid hormone synthesis (STAR gene mutations). Fewer than 50 cases reported worldwide, <0.01 per 100k births.
Extremely rare mitochondrial metabolism disorder caused by SLC25A19 mutations. Fewer than 20 families reported in medical literature. Estimated <0.001 per 100k births.
Hereditary congenital facial paresis type 3 is an extremely rare genetic disorder. No population-based epidemiological data available; estimate <0.01 per 100k births based on case report frequency.
Extremely rare multisystem disorder with <50 cases reported worldwide. <0.01 per 100k births.

Very rare genetic syndrome with elevated alkaline phosphatase and intellectual disability. Prevalence estimated <0.1 per 100k based on limited case reports in medical literature. No population-based registry data available.

Congenital myasthenic syndrome (CMS) type 13 is an extremely rare autosomal inherited neuromuscular disorder. Overall CMS incidence is approximately 0.3-0.5 per 100k live births. Type 13 represents one of 20+ genetic subtypes of CMS. Estimated type 13 incidence <0.01 per 100k based on very limited case reports. Characterized by impaired neuromuscular transmission.

Nonprogressive cerebellar ataxia with mental retardation is a rare neurogenetic condition. Estimated <0.01 per 100k based on limited syndromic classification. Very low confidence due to rarity, heterogeneity of underlying genetic causes, and lack of systematic epidemiological studies.
HTX6 is rare genetic subtype of heterotaxy syndrome. Estimated <0.1 per 100k based on genetic databases and case reports.

Centronuclear myopathy type 4 (CNM4) is an extremely rare genetic muscle disorder. <0.001 per 100k based on case reports. Specific genetic subtypes of centronuclear myopathy have very limited epidemiological data; known from isolated case reports only.

ALS type 18 is a specific genetic subtype (associated with FUS mutations and other genetic loci). Global ALS incidence is ~2-3 per 100k, but this represents all ALS subtypes. Genetic subtypes are much rarer. Estimated incidence of ALS18 at <0.1 per 100k. Limited specific epidemiological data on this genetic subtype.

Adams-Oliver syndrome type 3 (DOCK6-related) is an extremely rare autosomal recessive disorder characterized by scalp defects and nail dystrophy. Fewer than 100 cases reported worldwide, estimated <0.01 per 100k.
Joubert syndrome type 18 (TMEM216-related) is an extremely rare genetic disorder with only scattered case reports. Estimated <0.01 per 100k births based on case frequency.

Loeys-Dietz syndrome type 4 is an extremely rare connective tissue disorder. Related Loeys-Dietz syndromes (types 1-3) combined estimate <1 per 100k. Type 4 is substantially rarer; estimated <0.1 per 100k.
Specific genetic subtype of Weill-Marchesani syndrome. <0.1 per 100k births based on molecular genetics case series.
Spermatogenic failure type 10 is specific genetic subtype; extremely rare genetic disorder affecting male fertility.

Extremely rare autosomal recessive congenital muscular dystrophy. Type A, 8 (MDDGA8) is one of the rarest subtypes with fewer than 50 documented cases worldwide. Estimated <0.01 per 100k births based on case report frequency.

Highly specific genetic form of amelogenesis imperfecta. Amelogenesis imperfecta overall prevalence 1 in 600 to 1 in 30,000 (regional variation). Hypomaturation type IIA4 is a specific subtype affecting <0.5 per 100k globally. Using prevalence metric appropriate for genetic disorder.

Rare genetic syndrome combining microcephaly, short stature, and polymicrogyria, with variable seizure manifestation. Broader category than C4225499 (which requires seizures). Estimated <0.01 per 100k incidence. Limited epidemiological data, primarily case reports.

Joubert Syndrome 19 is a specific genetic subtype of Joubert Syndrome (rare cerebellar developmental disorder). Extremely rare, likely <0.1 per 100k births. No systematic incidence data; estimates based on case reports only.

Type 7 variant of Seckel syndrome, a rare autosomal recessive primordial dwarfism syndrome. Characterized by severe intrauterine growth restriction, microcephaly, and typical facial features. Estimated <0.01 per 100k births. Very few cases reported in literature.
Extremely rare cobalamin metabolism disorder (MMACHC gene defect). cblJ type is one of the rarest subtypes, <50 cases reported globally, <0.001 per 100k births.

Extremely rare autosomal recessive form of genetic deafness. Prevalence estimated at <0.05 per 100k based on genetic database frequencies. Only case reports available, no systematic epidemiological data.
Rare genetic autoinflammatory syndrome (PLCG2 gain-of-function). Extremely rare, <10 families reported in literature.
Rare autosomal recessive distal spinal muscular atrophy subtype. <0.1 per 100k births based on molecular genetics case series.
Hypogonadotropic hypogonadism type 16 with anosmia: rare genetic form, <1 per 100k estimated.
DBA is rare inherited bone marrow disorder; incidence ~5-10 per million live births (~0.5-1 per 100k births). DBA-11 is one of 19+ complementation groups; estimated <0.02 per 100k population.
PBD14B is rare genetic subtype of peroxisomal biogenesis disorders. Estimated <0.1 per 100k based on genetic databases.

Specific genetic mitochondrial disorder (COPD11) from molecular classification. Extremely rare; fewer than 20 cases reported worldwide. Incidence cannot be reliably estimated from population registries.

Combined oxidative phosphorylation deficiency 12 (COXPD12) is an extremely rare autosomal recessive mitochondrial disorder. Overall mitochondrial disease incidence is 1-5 per 100k. COXPD12 is a specific genetic subtype with very limited case reports globally (<10-20 known cases). Incidence estimated <0.01 per 100k births based on case frequency and genetic epidemiology.
Rare mitochondrial disorder affecting oxidative phosphorylation. Type 14 is one of multiple genetic subtypes with <100 total cases, <0.01 per 100k.
COXPD15 is an extremely rare mitochondrial disorder affecting complex I-IV assembly. Fewer than 50 cases reported globally in medical literature. Incidence estimated <0.01 per 100k births.

PCH8 is one of >10 specific genetic subtypes of pontocerebellar hypoplasia. Extremely rare congenital neurological disorder with fewer than 100 reported cases globally. Autosomal recessive inheritance with heterogeneous mutations. Incidence <0.01 per 100k births.

Congenital leptin deficiency (LEPOB) is an extremely rare autosomal recessive genetic disorder with fewer than 100 cases reported worldwide. Leptin dysfunction encompasses mutations in leptin or its receptor (LEPR). Estimated <0.01 per 100k based on genetic disease frequency databases.

Joubert syndrome type 20 is an extremely rare cerebellar disorder with autosomal recessive inheritance. Joubert syndrome overall has estimated incidence of <1 per 100k, with type 20 being a rare subtype.

column9: Case reports and medical literature; OI registries
column14: Osteogenesis imperfecta (all types) ~0.6 per 100k births. Type XIV is one of the rarest subtypes with only a handful of reported cases worldwide. <0.01 per 100k estimated.

Microcephalic primordial dwarfism Alazami type is an extremely rare autosomal recessive genetic disorder. Microcephalic primordial dwarfism overall incidence approximately 1 per million births (<0.01 per 100k), with Alazami type being one of multiple rare subtypes. No systematic epidemiological data available.
Autosomal recessive osteopetrosis type 8 is a rare skeletal dysplasia with <100 cases worldwide. Estimated <0.01 per 100k births based on case frequency.

Rare congenital eye condition. Microphthalmia with coloboma (specific types) estimated at <1 per 100,000 births. This specific phenotype (COLOBOMA 9) represents a rare genetic variant. Limited published epidemiological data; mostly case reports and small clinical series.
Rare form of Bruton-like immunodeficiency. Very few cases reported globally. Prevalence <0.05 per 100k.

column9: Case reports and case series in medical literature
column14: Fibrous dysplasia of bone is rare (~1 per 4000-40000). When combined with intramuscular myxoma (Mazabraud syndrome), this represents an extremely rare genetic condition with <200 cases reported worldwide. Estimated <0.01 per 100k births. Limited epidemiological literature.

15q24 microdeletion is a rare genetic disorder. Fewer than 100 cases reported worldwide. No systematic epidemiological data available; confidence capped at 0.3 due to absence of population-based incidence estimates.
Treatment-resistant myoclonic epilepsy. Represents subset of myoclonic epilepsy cases (~30-40%). Estimated ~2 per 100k based on epilepsy registries.

column9: WHO Global Oral Health Data Bank; multiple epidemiological surveys
column14: Early childhood caries (ECC) affects ~28% of preschool-age children globally. Reported as prevalence since it's a chronic condition. Incidence data limited but prevalence well-documented.

Psychosexual dysfunction is broad symptom category affecting 10-30% of adults. Estimated new cases ~2000 per 100k annually. Concept coherence low; heterogeneous etiologies (psychological, medical, relational).

Extremely rare genetic subtype of primary pulmonary hypertension associated with hereditary hemorrhagic telangiectasia (HHT). Limited epidemiological data; estimated <0.5 per 100k based on HHT prevalence (~1-2 per 100k) and frequency of pulmonary involvement.
Extremely rare autosomal recessive skeletal dysplasia with dwarfism and brachydactyly. Fewer than 100 cases worldwide reported. Type 2 variant of Smith-Mccort dysplasia.

Ultra-rare genetic disorder (SPG57, autosomal recessive). Only handful of cases reported in medical literature. Estimated <0.001 per 100k. Specific genetic subtype with extremely limited prevalence data.

Specific genetic form of Bardet-Biedl Syndrome. BBS overall incidence ~0.5-1 per 100k births. Type 17 represents subset of total cases. Estimated ~0.6 per 100k births based on genetic population studies.

Dysgnathia (jaw size/position abnormalities) encompasses malocclusion and skeletal jaw discrepancies. Estimated ~800 per 100k based on orthodontic epidemiology studies showing significant malocclusion in ~8% of population.

Continuous spike-wave activity in slow sleep (CSWS/electrical status epilepticus in sleep, ESES) is a rare EEG pattern associated with severe childhood epilepsy. Estimated <0.5 per 100k children based on case reports.

Extremely rare X-linked genetic skin disorder with mutilating palmoplantar keratoderma and periorificial plaques. Very specific phenotype with estimated <50 known cases worldwide, <0.001 per 100k incidence. Lacks systematic epidemiological studies.
Specific genetic subtype of bone marrow failure. <0.1 per 100k based on molecular genetics case series.
Rare genetic iron metabolism disorder, likely related to mitochondrial dysfunction. Fewer than 100 families documented worldwide. <0.01 per 100k incidence.
Fanconi anemia overall incidence ~1-2 per million live births. FA-Q is one of 22 complementation groups; extremely rare subtype with <10 families reported globally. Estimated <0.01 per 100k.
NGLY1 deficiency is ultra-rare congenital disorder of deglycosylation with multisystem involvement. Estimated <0.1 per 100k based on genetic databases with <100 reported cases worldwide.

Very rare genetic brain malformation disorder. Estimated <1 per 100,000 births based on pediatric neurology case series. Complex cortical dysplasia with multiple brain malformations type 2 is a specific genetic form with limited epidemiological data.
Meckel syndrome type 11 is an extremely rare genetic disorder with autosomal recessive inheritance. Fewer than 50 cases reported worldwide in medical literature. Estimated at <0.01 per 100k births.
Rare genetic pigmentation disorder (DUH type 3). Extremely rare autosomal recessive condition, <0.01 per 100k based on limited case reports.
ILFS1 is rare genetic disorder causing acute infantile liver failure. Estimated ~0.12 per 100k births based on pediatric hepatology case series.
CPVT type 5: rare cardiac genetic condition, <0.5 per 100k estimated.
